intro: Stigmaphyllon crenatum, commonly known as the serrated stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or clayey soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
